name: Overnight Slow Cooker Bread
author: Bren
summary: I developed this recipe for those days when you want homemade bread but you don't want to turn on the oven and heat the house. It's simple to make with ingredients that you probably have on hand. I get this started in the evening to enjoy for lunch. The longer the dough is allowed to ferment, the more complex the flavor of the loaf.
directions: Place 3 1/2 cups flour, water, salt, and yeast in a large glass or ceramic bowl; mix by hand until just incorporated
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it on a thick kitchen towel on the counter
Let sit on the counter for 12 to 18 hours
Sprinkle a clean work surface with 2 tablespoons flour
Scrape the dough (it will be sticky) from the bowl onto the work surface
Stretch and fold the dough over several times, working in some of the flour
Place parchment paper inside a slow cooker, making sure to drape it up the sides
Place the dough in the center of the slow cooker, and trim off any parchment paper that hangs over the rim
Place a double layer of paper towels over the slow cooker and secure the lid
Cook on High without peeking for 2 hours
Remove bread to a cooling rack and allow to cool completely before slicing
